Posts.Content: My arm is feeling a little strange slightly bigger and uncomfortable I'm having surgery tomorrow to remove breast lump and some lymph nodes cud I already have lymphodeama and will it make surgery more difficult ?
Posts.Title: Lymphodeama

Posts.Content: Thanks for that reply it was very helpful. I'm not quite used to this online communication but I have a feeling I will be before too long and yes it is a lumpectomy I'm having.
Posts.Title: Lymphodeama

Posts.Content: I did three FEC and three taxotere I found first ten days I wasn't very lively but then things improve if u keep a diary it helps for round two and three as u know what to expect there is a pattern. Taxotere I was different altogether I felt more fatigued BUT I'm through it all and now it's over I can say I didn't find it a walk in the park but I expected a lot worse x it's very doable x. I was lucky not to lose my hair, I used the cold cap which worked well for me x
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in 11 days.....

Posts.Content: Thank you both for replying , if it's the same tomorrow I will visit my gp, it's very itchy and a bit like allergy x
Posts.Title: Red neck

Posts.Content: I had my second tax last tues and I've felt pretty rubbish since, I've also developed a red itchy neck!! Has anyone else had skin problems? I'm usually sensitive to perfume products etc .
Posts.Title: Red neck

Posts.Content: A good nights sleep goes a long way to making us feel better , I hope your painkillers help x
Posts.Title: Pain and lack of sleep

Posts.Content: What do you all think of this fantastic boost of donations? For anyone who hasn't heard of it someone took a photo of themselves without makeup and nominated their friends to do the same also texting to donate Â£3 to cancer research for breast cancer I believe it started on Twitter but then Facebookers did it too .
Posts.Title: Selfies and donations

Posts.Content: Yes there have been some very brave ladies!!
Posts.Title: Selfies and donations

Posts.Content: Impressive tattoo ðŸ˜˜
Posts.Title: Selfies and donations

Posts.Content: There's always someone who finds a reason to moan but they thankfully are a minority on this cause .
Posts.Title: Selfies and donations

Posts.Content: Would stopping letrozole cause mood swings? I stopped 3 days ago and I feel downright miserable and my other half can do nowt right he’s irritating the life out of me x
Posts.Title: Letrozole and mood swings

Posts.Content: My understanding of my clearance was just that, I was told they take a scoop of fatty tissue containing lymph glands I had 13 of which 7 were cancerous some people may have 30 or more we all have a different amount, I'm not medical either but now I'm going to be asking my oncologist to clarify as I did feel happy that I had no lymph nodes left there
Posts.Title: Confused??????

Posts.Content: Hi, I got through FEC with a few trips to a&e and on the safe side stays in hospital but otherwise not too bad, doxetaxel was a totally different experience where FEC caused fatigue it was short lived but doxetaxel seemed to have a accumulative effect and muscles ached for even a few weeks after last dose. Having said that it was bearable as long as I didn't try and do too much. I lost no nails and didn't apply any nail varnish at all , I may be a lucky exception . I hope you get through with little side effects x
Posts.Title: Docetaxil experiences

Posts.Content: You have got to be going out of your mind xxx. I hope ct scan can give you good results and peace of mind xx
Posts.Title: Need more help girls....

Posts.Content: Can anyone tell me how long the tightness in my veins will take to go away, cause being FEC ?
Posts.Title: Damaged veins

Posts.Content: Oh dear it's kinda painfully tight !!
Posts.Title: Damaged veins

Posts.Content: Thanks ann Maria yes it does help to know at least the pain will go. They are a mess after only two cycles of FEC
Posts.Title: Damaged veins

Posts.Content: I was in tears most of yesterday but when asked why I couldn't really say, I had my first of 18 weeks of chemo last week and I feel if I'm not feeling sick or looking ill everyone just lets me get on, well just cos I'm not saying how I'm feeling every Minuit doesn't mean I'm fine. That was my one and only tearful day so far and not like me at all. We will get through this cos we have no choice xx good luck and I hope your side effects are small mine haven't been bad x ðŸ˜˜
Posts.Title: Every day stress

Posts.Content: Lumpectomy full node clearance, three FEC three taxotere 20 rads I've done it !! Letrozole for five years to do but I feel I can get back to being me. Good luck to all of you starting on your journey . At the beginning I found it daunting but now it's over and I look back I can say it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be x
Posts.Title: I did it!! ðŸ˜œ

Posts.Content: I've had FEC three weeks ago and advice given to me I found helped was to drink lots of water take anti sickness meds rest when tired. I really sailed through it and I'm hoping the same for my next cycle on Wednesday x good lipuck with yours x
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: I didn't know numbers existed I was just told I had a small amount of being hormone receptive but they would give hormone treatment anyway for five to ten years I'm going to have to ask numbers now x
Posts.Title: Hormone positive receptors..

Posts.Content: I've had the surgery which I have to say wasn't as bad as I expected. I go on tues to be told my treatment which I suspect is still chemo and radiotherapy. I think it's not knowing how that will make me feel is the worst part. You already knowing what your exhaustion and fatigue feels like with ME you must be worried so much more. Is it definite you will need chemo?
Posts.Title: New to Group

Posts.Content: I've tried to work it out using the guide but I'm none the wiser I'm not sure of size of lump removed It was said it was small but it had spread to 7 nodes. I'm taking a guess at a 2
Posts.Title: Cancer stage, cancer grade

Posts.Content: My eyes were sore during first FEC still had eyelashes I was told it was the chemo drying out my eyes in the same way it had everything else was prescribed visco tears which helped x
Posts.Title: lashes

Posts.Content: Hi, I've no idea if this could be related but I spoke with my oncologist recently about hormone treatment and it's effects I was told most people tolerate it well but can cause joint and bone pain which if that happened they would do a deeper bone scan than I'd had previously to ensure it wasn't osteoporosis , I do hope it's nothing serious but understand you would be concerned x
Posts.Title: Back pain and very scared

Posts.Content: I've already bought my factor 50 and being extra cautious it's got insect and wasp repellent in it too I also love the sun but taking no chances x
Posts.Title: SUNSHINE!

Posts.Content: Good luck and I have to agree with everyone else op was nothing as I had imagined, I also was pleased to get the process started to get the bad stuff out xx
Posts.Title: Op tomorrow

Posts.Content: Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Op tomorrow

Posts.Content: Wishing you a speedy recovery xx
Posts.Title: Op tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi, I only pop on this site now and again now but when I was diagnosed 16 months ago I was on every day! I had lumpectomy full node clearance chemo and radiotherapy and am now on lestozole for five years I didn't lose me hair though it did thin as I used the cold cap,the unknown is probably worse than the treatment, I didn't think I'd ever get back to normality but here I am good luck with all your treatment and a speedy journey to the end of it x
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: I noticed first wee smelled funny and then I've been again and still is but I still have the red stuff coming out as only been a few hours. You've not got stinging or anything have you? Cos one of them I was told causes sistitis x
Posts.Title: urine smell

Posts.Content: Wow!!! You sound like you're in a very good place. Roll on my time,though I'm gonna keep the husband x
Posts.Title: Almost 2 years on - the good things!

Posts.Content: Pleased to hear uve started your journey, it means the end is nearer x
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo Today

Posts.Content: I find it strange how we all react differently to the same drug, I've been fortunate on FEC very little to complain about, I'm terrified of docetaxel as I'm thinking it can't all be plain sailing x. I hope you have a really easy time with it x
Posts.Title: Moving from FEC to Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hope your first chemo was ok x. How was cold cap? I used it and used loreal elvive which is my usual shampoo , I used less and only wiped over hair rather than washing my scalp, I managed to keep most of my hair tho went a little thin on top but nothing to bad, the main thing is making sure cap fits snugly x
Posts.Title: 26 years old, diagnosed with breast cancer, first chemo tomorrow!

Posts.Content: Sounds nasty, do you have a 24 hr number where you could ask for advice? I'm 57 and finished my three FEC and start doxetaxel on tues. Hope your mam is ok , has she had chicken pox?
Posts.Title: Spots/rash

Posts.Content: Hi, I had my first yesterday and I've phoned the nurses twice already about meds and horrendous nausea all night which has improved I'm also belching continuously roll on the better days I've been in bed all afternoon so much for steroids making me hyper. Sorry your still having trouble with scar and cording physio gave me excerises take care and I hope your bad days are over soon ðŸ˜˜
Posts.Title: after effects chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks George and Jackie wish I'd read that before I thought I could tackle a weekends worth of housework lol soon found out I couldn't x
Posts.Title: after effects chemo

Posts.Content: Well I have to say yesterday and today I've felt so much better with the sickly feeling , hopefully the worst is over for this session .
Posts.Title: after effects chemo

Posts.Content: There are so many abbreviations like mx, fec, diep,and many more that I have to go google , I would prefer the full wording.
Posts.Title: Abbreviations

Posts.Content: That was very informative xx good idea the list I was pleased to see I wasn't the only one x
Posts.Title: Abbreviations

Posts.Content: Excellent!! :))
Posts.Title: Abbreviations

Posts.Content: My goodness my little swelling pales into background when I've read your journey xx good luck for yours x I too am hoping to try the cold cap when my chemo starts but it's the first I've heard of injecting ones self !! X
Posts.Title: Self injections for 7 days

Posts.Content: I've been caught doing a bit of this and that and told "you shouldn't be doing that" my reply is well how else will it get done? It's a bit late then saying you only have to ask I've had a lot of offers but not many put actions into play. What I wanted to ask was how did seroma heamatoma and cording improve?
Posts.Title: your thoughts please-help should I have to ask or should it be offered...

Posts.Content: I used the cold cap and although my hair thinned I still kept most of it Â one thing I will say though for it to be successful the cap needs to fit snuggle and don't feel you are being a pain by asking nurses to adjust it. X
Posts.Title: Cold Caps

Posts.Content: I'm still waiting for a start date for my FEC-T but has it happens I've developed infection in my breast tho not near incision I've been on anti biotics since last Thursday but they've been doubled since Monday , I so want to get started. Good luck with yours xx
Posts.Title: Startin cHemo next week

Posts.Content: My breast cancer was diagnosed a year ago but after lumpectomy and nodes removed chemo and radio I can now look forward to 2015 . Merry Xmas to u all
Posts.Title: Counting my blessings

Posts.Content: My question was answered when I ended up in a&e yesterday morning along with the shooting stabbing pains which I assumed were from chemo (taxotere). I developed a high temp felt really poorly but within 1hr of intravenous anti biotic and codeine the pains went so now I don't know if it was chemo or infection.
Posts.Title: Doxetaxel and codiene

Posts.Content: I've been taking both ibuprofen and paracetamol but it's barely touching this pain from doxetaxel !! I'm at chemo unit tomorrow so will ask then. Thanks x
Posts.Title: Doxetaxel and codiene

Posts.Content: I hope your feeling a little better xx
Posts.Title: Feeling rough at minute

Posts.Content: Is it ok to take codiene while on doxetaxel ?
Posts.Title: Doxetaxel and codiene

Posts.Content: Not surprised your feeling a bit weepy , it will get easier and less painful but do take all painkillers. And for me the most important thing was to do the exercises straight away to ensure you don't get shoulder problems. Best wishes x I'm three weeks ahead of you x
Posts.Title: Feeling rough at minute

Posts.Content: That's terrible!! I was given ibuprofen codeine and paracatamol and told to take them because you aren't going to have full range of movement if your in pain xx
Posts.Title: Feeling rough at minute

Posts.Content: I've just finished 20 rads 5 of which were boosters , my boob is a bit tender but nothing I can't cope with my skin is a bit sore under my arm and around my nipple but I've had worse sunburn x I just keep putting on the cream x
Posts.Title: rads and pain!!!

Posts.Content: My understanding of the steroids is that they are to help reduce the side effects of the chemo . x
Posts.Title: steroids?

Posts.Content: Yes Julie I suppose your right hot flushes are a small price to pay I think I was feeling a bit why me?
Posts.Title: Hormone receptive

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your comments it always helps to know somebody else is coping with these things x. Does hormone treatment begin after chemo and radiotherapy ?
Posts.Title: Hormone receptive

Posts.Content: Rebecca I've just been on your link page and it made me smile :) I hope at the end of all of my treatment I can say the same as you x mind up till now I have to say my care has been 100% xx
Posts.Title: Hormone receptive

Posts.Content: I had a ct with dye for a screening trial and was found to be allergic to the dye so when I had my next ct scan no dye was used and my oncologist assured me they could see all they needed to x
Posts.Title: Is a CT scan without contrast dye as effective??

Posts.Content: I found my hardest part of this was telling my children , I say children my daughter is 37 and my youngest 21 but they are still my children. I was amazed at how brilliant they have been obviously upset initially but very positive and supportive x.
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed with DCIS queery invasive

Posts.Content: I was told today my cancer is hormone receptive like it was a good thing, after reading other peoples comments I'm not so sure....all those side effects hot flushes sweats, I've gone through the menopause already I really don't fancy having to go through it all again!!!
Posts.Title: Hormone receptive

Posts.Content: The info I was given which is from macmillan site says signs of infection are discoloured fluid coming from exit site , exit site becomes red swollen or painful and the obvious if you developed a fever x
Posts.Title: PICC line problems itching and redness
